job description:
This is a contract (PART TIME) position. This position will last 3 months at 10-12 hours per week.

Udacity's mission is to democratize education. We're an online learning platform offering groundbreaking education in fields such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, robotics, virtual reality, and more. Focused on self-empowerment through learning, Udacity is making innovative technologies such as self-driving cars available to a global community of aspiring technologists, while also enabling learners at all levels to skill up with essentials like programming, web development, and data science.

Udacity is looking for part-time instructors to create amazing educational experiences that truly make a difference in the world. As an Instructor at Udacity, you will create a course and project as part of an upcoming Nanodegree program. Udacity's content development team will provide you with deep support as you design and produce your course, allowing you to focus entirely on transforming your expertise into a valuable learning experience for students. Your course will be taken by tens of thousands of students and help develop the next generation of data engineering talent!

Responsibilities:
  • Design a new data engineering course, including instructional videos, quizzes, and hands-on projects.
  • Break down complex technical subjects into more easily understood, self-contained, visually rich learning experiences.
  • Collaborate with the content development team to iterate on the course based on internal and external feedback.
Requirements:
  • Strong programming background in Python and SQL
  • Expertise in one or more of the following areas
  • Data Modeling
  • Data Warehousing
  • Data Streaming
  • Data Pipelines
  • AWS Data Architecture (S3, Redshift, etc.)
  • Apache Spark
  • Apache Kafka
  • Apache Airflow
  • Experience teaching, mentoring, presenting, building curriculum, or breaking down complex subjects into simple instructions (e.g. conference talks, blog posts, books authored, or courses taught).
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply.
